name: ButtonGroup
purpose: Visually and functionally group buttons and button-adjacent controls into a single cohesive control surface.
useWhen: Pairing buttons with inputs, selects, dropdowns, or popovers
rules: ButtonGroup does not manage selection state
Actions inside a ButtonGroup execute immediately
Visual grouping implies related functionality, not shared state
Orientation may be horizontal or vertical
visualRules: Buttons retain their individual semantic variants
Separators are recommended for non-outline button variants
Outline buttons do not require separators due to visible borders
doNotUseWhen: Selecting between mutually exclusive options (use ToggleGroup)
aiHints: Use ButtonGroup for split buttons and compound controls
Do not replace ToggleGroup with ButtonGroup when state selection is required
ButtonGroup may wrap non-button controls when they participate in a single action cluster
